radirius.merc.framework

Class Runner

  • java.lang.Object
    • radirius.merc.framework.Runner

  • public class Runner
extends Object
    A class that will run your core, and give out the graphics object, current core, resource manager, and input ly.
    Author:
    wessles

        HEIGHT - The height of the display

      • init

        public void init(Core core,
        boolean fullscreen,
        boolean vsync)
        Initializes the library
        Parameters:
        core - The core we shall run
        fullscreen - Whether or not the display is fullscreen
        vsync - Whether or not we are vsynced

      • init

        public void init(radirius.merc.framework.Runner.InitSetup iniset)
        Initializes the library
        Parameters:
        iniset - The initialization setup filled with information to initialize with.

      • init

        public void init(Core core,
        int WIDTH,
        int HEIGHT,
        boolean fullscreen,
        boolean vsync,
        boolean initonseperatethread,
        boolean devconsole)
        Initializes the library
        Parameters:
        core - The core we shall run
        WIDTH - The width of the display
        HEIGHT - The height of the display
        fullscreen - Whether or not the display is fullscreen
        vsync - Whether or not we are vsynced
        initonseperatethread - Whether or not to initialize the Core on a seperate thread
        devconsole - Whether or not we are enabling the developers console

      • addDebugData

        public void addDebugData(String name,
                String value)
        Adds information to the debugdata. Debug data is wiped every single update frame, so this is to be called every frame.
